A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Although there were some elements that were good\, specifically the acting of Mark Hamill\, Daisy Ridley and Adam Driver\, and the new creatures were cool to watch\, the movie falls flat dramatically. 

Although the film makes it seem as though things of major consequence are going down\, and could go down\, the things that are happening actually only affect the CGI background characters. Leia not dying when she should have told the audience that no major deaths were to be expected this movie. Yes Luke dies at the end\, but it was anti-climatic when it turned out he "force powered" himself to death. The fact he doesn't actually duel Kylo Ren was them taking away the biggest moment of the movie for a suprise reveal which was lame and uncalled for. 

The story lines that were introduced in episode 7 also have little tangible impact on the actual story line\, the Knights of Ren are only indirectly referenced\, and Rey's parents\, who we have been led to beleive are important (if not to the world but to Rey)\, are just low life junkies and we are told to essentially forget about them. If so why were we asked to think about them in depth in TFW! 

Horrible movie from a movie lovers prospective\, and unholy treason to a star wars fan.
